meanings.definition: A town or neighborhood characterized by a large number of shacks.
meanings.sent1: The shacktown was filled with small, simple houses made of wood.
meanings.sent2: People in the shacktown lived in basic homes made from scrap materials.
meanings.sent3: The children in the shacktown loved playing hide-and-seek among the shacks.
meanings.sent4: In the heart of the shacktown, each shack told a different story of struggle.
meanings.sent5: The image of the shacktown lingered in his mind, a symbol of resilience.

meanings.definition: To live in or build a shack in a town or neighborhood.
meanings.sent1: They decided to shacktown near the river for a peaceful life.
meanings.sent2: Many families choose to shacktown in rural areas for a simpler lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he would shacktown in the backyard if he could build a shack fast enough.
meanings.sent4: Her dream was to shacktown on a hill, overlooking the valley below.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, they began to shacktown, creating a cozy shelter for the night.
